result.text:
It was raining hard. But if I learnt something it’s that no matter how many people show up for your gig, every single soul counts and you never know who is in the audience!
 
Seeing the heads nodding and hearing the reaction were truly heart-warming:
 
“I love your playlist!”
“You should come back for a residency!”
“Are you a professional DJ?” 😃

@BruceMelodie 🔥

result.text:
Leaving Rwanda is bittersweet. I have the deepest respect for the people here, how the country has recovered and reconciled from the civil war, and how it has risen to become Africa’s fastest-growing economy.
 
I call it “the Switzerland of Africa”, with its landlocked economy, the nickname “The Land of a Thousand Hills” thanks to its green landscape, breathtaking topography and volcano mountain ranges, as well as its four official languages (French, English, Kinyarwanda and Kiswahili).
 
BTW, did you know that @GlblCtzn will hold its first-ever #MoveAfrika event in Rwanda headlined by @kendricklamar on Dec. 6? 
 
I never thought my new #DJ hobby would bring me this far. It’s a proof that you just have to start and go for it!
 
Thank you to the wonderful hotel staff and all my friends for coming! 🫶🏻
 
@raoulrugamba @africaincolors @visitrwanda_now @RDBrwanda 💙💛💚
 
#DJAmani #VisitRwanda #travel #music #martinastravels

Words can’t express how much I’ve seen and experienced again in these couple of days in #Rwanda and #Uganda.

Traveling is the most wonderful thing.

Thank you to the most hospitable people in this part… https://t.co/NmNuwfpqTR

result.text:
Powered by women, @QuestionCafeRW is one of the must-visit places in #Kigali.

In 2013, @BloombergDotOrg invested in the innovative training of coffee farmers and producers, bringing smallholder farmers up through the coffee value chain. 

When you buy Question Coffee, 30% of the purchase price goes directly to the cooperative for their coffee beans and 70% is reinvested into professional training and trading programs for women coffee farmers. 

By drinking this coffee, you are investing in women farmers as they produce high quality products that increase economic independence for themselves and their families.

Learn more at: https://t.co/TWxST6rxo9 

🤎 🇷🇼 ☕️ 

#Rwanda #martinastravels #DJAmani

result.text:
Why? 

✔️ Stunning scenery, extraordinary biodiversity, with incredible #wildlife 
✔️ Wonderful hospitality and the friendliest, warmest people 
✔️ It's a landlocked country in East #Africa, the capital is Kigali and has an international airport 
✔️ Kinyarwanda, English and French are the official languages, and Kiswahili is widely spoken

result.text:
✔️ It's one of the safest countries in the world for solo travellers 

✔️ Trekking to see the mountain gorillas in the @VolcanoesNP, the chimpanzees in Nyungwe National Park or visiting Lake Kivu, are some of the highlights 

✔️ Rwanda is a destination for eco-tourism, both luxury and budget 

✔️ Rwanda's #sustainability efforts: the country aims to achieve a climate-resilient economy by 2050 

✔️ Single-use plastic bags are banned nationwide and it is illegal for travellers to bring them into the country

@RutiJoel 🥳

result.text:
Rwanda has partnered with @GlblCtzn and creative imprint, pgLang's Move Afrika campaign that will create job and entrepreneurship opportunities for the continent’s emerging generations through an annual series of world-class live music events. 

Grammy Award, Pulitzer Prize winning artist and co-Founder of pgLang, @kendricklamar will headline the first event taking place on 6 December 2023 at @bkarenarw in Kigali, Rwanda.

Learn more https://t.co/qC20YzGewo

#MoveAfrika🇷🇼
